description: The sample database provides similar examples for each stage of the DSV framework.

deconstruct.input_text: Within 5 to 10 seconds after sensor A detects a fault, alarm B must sound and continue for at least 20 seconds.
deconstruct.reasoning: First, identify two atomic propositions: Sensor A detects a fault and Alarm B sounds. Then determine the temporal relationship: Alarm B must sound after Sensor A detects a fault. Finally, extract metric constraints: a time window of 5 to 10 seconds and a duration of at least 20 seconds.

deconstruct.input_text: After the system starts, the status light must turn on within 3 seconds.
deconstruct.reasoning: Identify two atomic propositions: System starts and Status light turns on. Determine the temporal relationship: The status light must turn on after the system starts. Extract metric constraint: a time window of 0 to 3 seconds.

deconstruct.input_text: The door should remain locked for at least 30 seconds after the alarm is triggered.
deconstruct.reasoning: Identify two atomic propositions: alarm is triggered and door remains locked. Determine temporal relation: door should remain locked after alarm is triggered. Extract metric constraint: at least 30 seconds duration.

synthesize.input_text: Alarm sounds within 5-10 seconds after sensor fault and lasts for 20 seconds
synthesize.reasoning: According to the semantic specification sketch, construct the MTL formula: G represents the global property, fault_A→ represents sensor fault as the antecedent, F_[5,10] represents eventually occurring within the time window of 5 to 10 seconds, alarm_B_on represents the alarm sounding, ∧ connects two conditions, and G_[0,20] alarm_B_on represents the alarm lasting for 20 seconds.

synthesize.input_text: Status light turns on within 3 seconds after system starts
synthesize.reasoning: Global property G, system start as the antecedent, connected by the implication symbol →, F_[0,3] represents the status light turning on eventually within the time window of 0 to 3 seconds.

synthesize.input_text: Door lock remains for at least 30 seconds after alarm is triggered
synthesize.reasoning: Global property G, alarm triggered as antecedent, implies door locked for at least 30 seconds using G_[0,30] to represent the duration constraint.

verify.output: Always, if sensor A detects a fault, then within a time window of 5 to 10 seconds, alarm B will sound and continue for at least 20 seconds.
verify.reasoning: G means always/globally, fault_A→ means if sensor A fails, F_[5,10] means eventually occurs within 5 to 10 seconds, alarm_B_on means alarm B sounds, ∧ means and, G_[0,20] alarm_B_on means alarm B continues for 20 seconds.

verify.output: Always, if the system starts, then the status light will turn on within 3 seconds.
verify.reasoning: G means always, system_start→ means if the system starts, F_[0,3] means eventually occurs within 0 to 3 seconds, status_light_on means the status light turns on.

verify.output: Always, if the alarm is triggered, then the door will remain locked for 30 seconds.
verify.reasoning: G means globally/always, alarm_triggered→ means if alarm is triggered, G_[0,30] door_locked means the door remains locked for the duration of 30 seconds.
